properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 11 at 8:02PM CST until February 12 at 6:00PM CST by NWS North Platte NE
properties.description:
...LIGHT SNOW AND STRONG WINDS WILL PRODUCE POTENTIALLY HAZARDOUS
TRAVEL DURING THE DAY WEDNESDAY...

.A strong Arctic cold front will move into the area by midday
Wednesday bringing the potential for light snow accumulations.
In addition, strong winds will lead to blowing snow and
visibility reductions. As temperatures fall rapidly, a flash
freeze of wet surfaces freeze is possible.

* WHAT...Snow expected with total accumulations of up to one
inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...Boyd and Holt Counties.

* WHEN...From 9 AM to 6 PM CST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and reduced
visibilities at times. The cold wind chills as low as 15 below
zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken
with even colder wind chills expected Wednesday night.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures falling through Wednesday
afternoon will lead to potential for flash freeze of wet
surfaces. A brief period of wintry mix is possible at the onset
of precipitation.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Call Nebraska 511 for the latest road information.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 6 PM CST WEDNESDAY
